title.narrative: Integral Health Care for Children: Capacity Strengthening for Early Childhood Development

description.narrative: The ultimate intended impact of this project in the long term is to contribute to the reduction of poverty in El Salvador by promoting an integral approach to child health. Despite the critical role that early childhood development plays in ensuring that children stay in school, achieve relevant qualifications and consequently earn sufficient income to break the cycle of intergenerational poverty, the investment in this area in El Salvador is very low. As a consequence, the Clinic designed this project with a focus on ensuring that children in the department of Chalatenango where the Clinic works receive adequate care in the cognitive, socio-emotional, communicational and motor development areas, in addition to the primary health care in which the Clinic already specialises in and delivers. This is to ensure that children’s health is treated integrally, and therefore not only their well-being is secured but also the ability to reach their full potential and ultimately become healthy and successful adults. The Clinic will complement this project with their day-to-day medical care that is and will continue to be provided by the Clinic’s medical team as well as by the team working at the Maternity Waiting Home.
